intro: Ateleia mcvaughii, commonly known as the Mexican false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red, with a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture. Ateleia mcvaughii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
